semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for Follow-up Visits After COVID-19 Infection Has Resolved
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 1. Chapter 1: Certain Infectious and Parasitic Diseases > g. Coronavirus infections > 1. COVID-19 infections > j. Follow-up visits after COVID-19 infection has resolved

content.full_text: For individuals who previously had COVID-19, without residual symptom(s) or condition(s), and are being seen for follow-up evaluation, and COVID-19 test results are negative, assign codes Z09, Encounter for follow-up examination after completed treatment for conditions other than malignant neoplasm, and Z86.16, Personal history of COVID-19. For follow-up visits for individuals with symptom(s) or condition(s) related to a previous COVID-19 infection, see guideline I.C.1.g.1.m. See Section I.C.21.c.8, Factors influencing health states and contact with health services, Follow-up (Evidence: pg no: 31, L40-L45)
content.summary: Provides coding instructions for follow-up visits after resolved COVID-19 infection, distinguishing between patients with and without residual symptoms (Evidence: pg no: 31, L40-L45)
key_concepts: Follow-up coding for resolved COVID-19 (Evidence: pg no: 31, L40-L43)
Negative test results requirement (Evidence: pg no: 31, L42)
No residual symptoms condition (Evidence: pg no: 31, L41-L42)
Dual code assignment Z09 and Z86.16 (Evidence: pg no: 31, L42-L43)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign Z09 and Z86.16 for follow-up visits after resolved COVID-19 without residual symptoms (Evidence: pg no: 31, L42-L43)
detailed_rules.explanation: For patients who previously had COVID-19, have no residual symptoms or conditions, are being seen for follow-up evaluation, and have negative COVID-19 test results, assign both Z09 and Z86.16 (Evidence: pg no: 31, L40-L43)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Different coding applies for follow-up visits with residual symptoms (Evidence: pg no: 31, L44-L45)
detailed_rules.explanation: For follow-up visits where individuals have symptoms or conditions related to previous COVID-19 infection, refer to guideline I.C.1.g.1.m for appropriate coding (Evidence: pg no: 31, L44-L45)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Determine if patient previously had COVID-19
Step 2: Assess for residual symptoms or conditions
Step 3: Verify negative COVID-19 test results
Step 4: If no residual symptoms and negative tests, assign Z09 and Z86.16
Step 5: If residual symptoms present, refer to guideline I.C.1.g.1.m

specific_codes.description: Encounter for follow-up examination after completed treatment for conditions other than malignant neoplasm (Evidence: pg no: 31, L42-L43)
specific_codes.context: For follow-up after resolved COVID-19 without residual symptoms

specific_codes.description: Personal history of COVID-19 (Evidence: pg no: 31, L43)
specific_codes.context: Used with Z09 for COVID-19 follow-up visits

breakdown.Z86: Personal history of certain other diseases

code_patterns.description: Dual coding for COVID-19 follow-up without residual symptoms (Evidence: pg no: 31, L42-L43)
code_patterns.explanation: Both codes required for complete follow-up documentation

references_to.title: Post COVID-19 Condition
references_to.explanation: Referenced for follow-up visits with residual symptoms

references_to.title: Factors influencing health states and contact with health services, Follow-up

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient presents for routine follow-up after COVID-19 recovery, no symptoms, negative test
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Follow-up visit for patient who had COVID-19 three months ago, fully recovered, no residual symptoms, recent COVID test negative
step_by_step: Step 2: Verify no residual symptoms or conditions
Step 3: Confirm negative COVID-19 test results
Step 4: Assign Z09 as primary diagnosis
Step 5: Assign Z86.16 as additional diagnosis

correct_coding.rationale: Follow-up examination code with personal history for complete documentation (Evidence: pg no: 31, L42-L43)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Missing the follow-up examination code Z09
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using only personal history code without follow-up code

warnings: Different coding applies when residual symptoms are present (Evidence: pg no: 31, L44-L45)
best_practices: Use both Z09 and Z86.16 for complete follow-up documentation (Evidence: pg no: 31, L42-L43)
Verify negative test results before using this coding approach (Evidence: pg no: 31, L42)
common_mistakes: Using only one code instead of both required codes
Not distinguishing between follow-up with and without residual symptoms
tips: Check for residual symptoms to determine appropriate guideline (Evidence: pg no: 31, L44-L45)
implementation_notes: Establish clear protocols for assessing residual symptoms
